intro: Zosterophyllanthos bovilingua, commonly known as the silverleaf spirea, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its dense, silvery foliage and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, white hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Zosterophyllanthos bovilingua is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
